line_1: I think upon thy bare and beaten sod;
line_2: When rain beats on my roof, wild storms abroad,

line_1: In lowly cottage, walled with mossy sod,
line_2: A hermit dwelt, who many a year had trod

line_1: And bow my heart upon the sod,
line_2: Or thou! memorial cross of God,

line_1: 'T was then the church-yard's hollow sod
line_2: With frantic step poor Nancy trod;

line_1: My self had rais'd and cover'd o'er with Sod?
line_2: When shall I see my Hut, the small Abode

line_1: Left a flower-circle on the sod.
line_2: And Hours that, laughing as they trode,

line_1: The Nymph, GOSSYPIA, treads the velvet sod,
line_2: And warms with rosy smiles the watery God;

line_1: O'er the grey matted moss, and pansied sod,
line_2: With step sublime the glowing Goddess trod,

line_1: Your Champion, cover'd by yon senseless Sod,
line_2: Weep, ye who bend beneath the savage Rod

line_1: She there shall dress a sweeter sod,
line_2: Than Fancy's feet have ever trod.

line_1: ON village green whose smooth and well-worn sod,
line_2: Cross pathed, with many a gossip's foot is trod;

line_1: Where these roses crown the sod,
For ye were nurtur'd on the sod
line_2: Where PETRARCH mourn'd, and LAURA trod;

line_1: Go — breathe responsive rituals o'er the sod
line_2: Go — vow that never shall their turf be trod

line_1: Whilst here, the veriest clown that treads the sod,
line_2: Without one scruple, gives the praise to GOD;

line_1: Decking with flow'rets fresh th' unsullied sod,)
line_2: Her fav'rite offspring's long and last abode.

line_1: Or roses issue from the humble sod,
line_2: When man shall know that he's the work of God.
